title: What Is Offside?
content: A player is offside if they're nearer the goal than the ball and second-last defender (including the goalkeeper) when the ball is passed.
description: Offside = closer to goal than ball and 2nd-last defender when ball is passed.

title: "Closer to the Goal" Meaning
content: Even if only a part of the attacker's body (like a toe or knee) is ahead of the second-last defender, they are still closer (so offside).
description: Partial offside with attacker's toe ahead

title: Position at the Kick
content: During a free kick, an attacker is only offside if they are in an offside position at the moment the ball is kicked, not when they receive it.
description: Position of attacker at the time of freekick is important.

title: Two Attackers Ahead of the Defender
content: The player receiving the ball will still be onside because the receiver is behind the ball.

title: You're Onside If...
content: Player is in their own half at the time of pass.
description: Player in own half is always onside

title: Exceptions: No Offside Here
content: No offside offence for any throw-in, goal-kick, and corner-kick.
